1. Your full name: M. FRANK MALONE

3. Date: MARCH 15TH, 1942.
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): STAYLER, ONTARIO.

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): DECEMBER, 1901.
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: NORTH TENIS, CANADIAN, QUEBEC.
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.)
9. What were your reasons for coming West? MY REASON WERE MY ONLY SISTER WAS LIVING IN REGINA AND SHE WANTED ME TO COME TO CANADA.
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?) MY SISTER.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

My sister and I.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

RAILROAD.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

AT WINNIPEG, I MET THE CARRIERS.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

REGINA 1873

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

AT TEMISCAIN/QUEBEC

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

PENHOLD, ALTA.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came?

I LEARNED THE BAKERY BUSINESS AND STORE CLERK. POSTMASTER AT TEMISCAIN QUEBEC. BRITISH AMERICAN BUSINESS AT TORONTO, ONT.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?

My sister and baby.

13. What means of transportation did you use?

Railroad.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

At Winnipeg. I met the couplers.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

Regina.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

At Temiskaming.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

Penhold, Alta.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?

I learned the bakery business at store clerk postmaster at Temiskaming American Business at British American Business at Toronto, Ont.
